gettingStarted.title: Getting started
gettingStarted.description: Start practicing in minutes with a guided setup.

localSuite.title: Local Suite
localSuite.description: Download the desktop launcher and explore local models.

sidebar.title: Reach out to your admin lead.
sidebar.subtitle: We keep the help center updated for core workflows. Team-specific policies live in your internal docs.

header.title: Launch your first practice session
header.subtitle: Get oriented in under five minutes. This portal walks you through the core workflow and gives you quick access to setup tools.

purpose.title: What this app is for
purpose.subtitle: A premium practice studio built for therapy micro-skills.
purpose.bodyOne: Therapy Studio helps you rehearse high-stakes client conversations by simulating realistic scenarios and scoring your response against the criteria you care about. Every session is designed to feel intentional, measurable, and repeatable.
purpose.bodyTwo: Each practice is centered on a task from the Library. You speak your response, review the AI evaluation, and then iterate with purpose. The result is deliberate, evidence-informed growth without the overhead of scheduling a full supervision session.

quickStart.title: 3-step quick start
quickStart.subtitle: From selection to feedback in a tight, repeatable loop.

chooseTask.title: Choose a task
chooseTask.description: Open the Library, filter by difficulty, and select a task that targets the skill you want to build.

configureAi.title: Configure your AI
configureAi.description: Run local services or connect OpenAI. The setup wizard verifies your stack and keeps you in control.

practiceReview.title: Practice + review
practiceReview.description: Run the scenario, speak your response, and review scoring plus coaching highlights in one view.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.subtitle: Quick fixes when setup or playback stalls.

localEndpoints.title: Local endpoints not responding
localEndpoints.body: Confirm the local launcher is running and that the Local AI Base URL in Settings matches the port shown in the desktop app. The most common issue is a port mismatch or firewall restriction.

missingOpenAiKey.title: Missing OpenAI key
missingOpenAiKey.body: If scoring won’t start, verify that the key is saved and validated in Settings. The setup wizard can walk you through the full verification flow.

workingOffline.title: Working offline
workingOffline.body: You can still browse the library and review prior sessions while offline. Practice sessions require either local inference or a connected OpenAI key.

header.title: What the app is doing
header.subtitle: Every practice session follows a predictable loop so you can focus on the skill, not the tooling.

flow.title: End-to-end flow
flow.subtitle: From task selection to performance insights.

selectTask.title: Select a task
selectTask.description: Pick a scenario from the Library that aligns with the micro-skill you want to practice.

generatePrompt.title: Generate the patient prompt
generatePrompt.description: The system delivers the simulated patient prompt via text or TTS, using local or OpenAI services.

recordResponse.title: Record your response
recordResponse.description: Speak or type your reply. The session captures audio and transcript data for evaluation.

evaluateCriteria.title: Evaluate against criteria
evaluateCriteria.description: Your response is scored against the rubric and compared to example benchmarks for the task.

reviewFeedback.title: Review feedback
reviewFeedback.description: Coaching highlights, rubric scoring, and improvement notes are surfaced in a single view.

trackProgress.title: Track progress
trackProgress.description: Sessions are saved in History so you can monitor growth and revisit coaching moments.

scoringSignals.title: Signals that influence scoring
scoringSignals.subtitle: The evaluation balances clarity, empathy, and adherence.

items.rubric: Rubric criteria defined by the task author
items.tone: Tone, pacing, and clinical intent extracted from your response
items.alignment: Alignment with example answers across difficulty levels
items.context: Session context, including task objectives and skill domain

callout.title: Want deeper diagnostics?
callout.body: Save a few sessions for the same task. The History view makes it easy to compare how your scoring shifts as you iterate on the same micro-skill.

header.title: What is deliberate practice?
header.subtitle: Deliberate practice is focused, feedback-rich rehearsal designed to improve a specific micro-skill instead of generalized performance.

application.title: How we apply it
application.subtitle: A structured loop that prioritizes clarity and feedback.
application.bodyOne: Each task in the Library is designed around a micro-skill: reflection, de-escalation, agenda setting, or another clinical competency. You repeat that micro-skill in realistic scenarios, receive targeted feedback, and then repeat the loop until the new behavior becomes automatic.
application.bodyTwo: The rubric-driven scoring and example comparisons keep practice grounded in measurable behaviors. That means you can track the specific dimensions that matter most to your clinical style.

habits.title: How to get the most out of it
habits.subtitle: Small habits that compound quickly.

items.focus: Focus on one skill per session to avoid diluting your attention.
items.listen: Listen to the patient prompt twice before responding to pick up nuance.
items.track: Track the same task across multiple sessions and review history weekly.
items.useFeedback: Use the feedback notes as a checklist for your next attempt.

callout.title: Practice with intention
callout.body: Consistency matters more than volume. A focused 10-minute loop, repeated daily, yields more sustainable progress than sporadic long sessions.

header.title: Therapy Studio
header.subtitle: A deliberate practice environment for therapists who want consistent, actionable feedback between supervision sessions.

product.title: Product statement
product.subtitle: Built for clarity, repeatability, and autonomy.
product.bodyOne: Therapy Studio blends guided simulations with structured evaluation so practitioners can rehearse difficult moments before they happen in real client care. Every session keeps you in control of the AI stack, the content, and the pace of practice.
product.bodyTwo: The experience is designed to feel premium and focused: a calm environment for reflection, with clear next steps and measurable progress.

items.audio: Audio and transcripts are only stored if you enable session storage in Settings.
items.apiKeys: API keys are stored securely and are never returned to the browser after saving.
items.localInference: Local inference keeps processing on your machine when you choose the local stack.

callout.title: Looking for version info?
callout.body: Build details are available from your deployment environment. If you need a specific build hash, check your hosting dashboard or release notes.

localSuite.title: Local Suite
localSuite.subtitle: Run local models with a cross-platform desktop launcher that exposes an OpenAI-compatible gateway.

overview.title: How Local Suite works
overview.subtitle: A desktop app runs the gateway on your machine and keeps the model layer observable, reliable, and offline-first.

cards.title: Cross-platform launcher
cards.description: Install the Local Suite app on macOS, Windows, or Linux to start, stop, and monitor local inference.
bullets: One-click start with health checks.
Built-in doctor diagnostics.
No cloud calls required.

cards.title: OpenAI-compatible gateway
cards.description: A single Base URL exposes OpenAI-style endpoints for scoring and speech so the app can plug in seamlessly.
bullets: POST /v1/responses for LLM scoring.
POST /v1/audio/speech for TTS.
POST /v1/audio/transcriptions for STT.

cards.title: Curated model catalog
cards.description: Browse pre-validated model options with hardware requirements, endpoint support, and tuning hints.
bullets: Filter by endpoint, provider, and hardware.
Copy model IDs into Settings.
Track RAM/VRAM needs up front.

paths.title: Choose your setup path
paths.subtitle: Most teams use Local Suite. Advanced users can bring their own models as long as endpoints match.

recommended.title: Use Local Suite (recommended)
recommended.body: Download the desktop app, select a model set, and paste the Base URL into Settings.
steps: Install the Local Suite app and sign in if prompted.
Pick a model bundle that matches your hardware, then start the gateway.
Copy the Base URL from the app into Settings → AI Providers.

advanced.title: Advanced: use your own models
advanced.body: Already running your own stack? As long as you expose the same endpoints, Therapy Studio can connect. If you want a lighter setup, run scripts/start_local_ai.py instead of the full Local Suite.
steps: Run scripts/start_local_ai.py (or your own server) to expose the OpenAI-style endpoints below.
Paste your Base URL into Settings → AI Providers and select the model IDs it advertises.

callout.body: The bundled script starts a lightweight FastAPI gateway that mirrors the Local Suite API surface.

downloads.title: Desktop downloads
downloads.subtitle: macOS installs are delivered via the Mac App Store. Windows and Linux builds come from GitHub Releases.
downloads.error: Unable to load GitHub releases. Showing cached links.

catalog.title: Available models
catalog.subtitle: Search across all local and proxy-backed models validated by the gateway.
catalog.searchPlaceholder: Search by name, endpoint, or provider
catalog.empty: No models match this search yet.

title.subtitle: You can run everything locally or connect OpenAI. We'll walk you through each option with step-by-step cards.

side.title: Quick checklist
side.subtitle: What powers the experience
side.description: Evaluations run on an LLM. Patient audio uses TTS. You can keep everything local, or let OpenAI handle both securely.
side.tipBody: You can switch later in Settings. If you skip now, practice will run in offline mode until a provider is configured.

choice.title: Choose your path
choice.description: Pick the setup that fits your workflow today.

local.title: Use my own models (local)
local.body: Run the LLM + TTS servers on your machine.

steps.title: Welcome to your practice studio
steps.description: This space simulates a patient conversation and then scores your response against the rubric you selected.
bullets: LLM scoring produces detailed coaching feedback.
TTS generates the patient's voice prompts.
You stay in control of which AI providers are used.

steps.title: What you need to run evaluations
steps.description: Evaluations require an LLM and TTS provider. You can keep everything local or connect OpenAI.
bullets: Local mode: run the bundled Python launcher.
OpenAI mode: add your API key once.
You can mix and match later.

steps.title: Choose how you'd like to proceed
steps.description: Pick a path on the right. You'll get guided steps and links.
bullets: Local setup = no external API calls.
OpenAI setup = fastest to start.
Skipping keeps practice in offline mode.

steps.title: Use Local Suite to run local models
steps.description: Local Suite is the cross-platform desktop launcher that runs the gateway and manages local inference.

steps.title: Connect Therapy Studio to the gateway
steps.description: Start Local Suite, copy the Base URL, and paste it into Settings to enable local scoring and speech.
bullets: Check the gateway health and model list in the desktop app.
Keep the Base URL consistent for both LLM and audio endpoints.
Switch AI mode to Local only or Local preferred.

steps.title: Advanced: run your own models
steps.description: If you already host models, expose OpenAI-compatible endpoints so the app can connect.
bullets: Required endpoints: /v1/responses, /v1/audio/speech, /v1/audio/transcriptions.
Optional: /v1/audio/translations for multilingual audio.
Return standard OpenAI response shapes.

steps.title: Generate your OpenAI API key
steps.description: The key lets us securely send evaluation prompts and text-to-speech requests to OpenAI.
bullets: We only use the key when you run evaluations or generate patient audio.
Keys are encrypted at rest and never shown after saving.
You can revoke the key anytime in OpenAI.

steps.title: Understand usage and cost
steps.description: Costs depend on the model and usage. Most sessions cost just a few cents, and you control limits.
bullets: Create a project to track usage by workspace.
Set a monthly cap to avoid surprises.
Review usage in the OpenAI dashboard anytime.

steps.title: Save the key in Settings
steps.description: Paste the key in the OpenAI section of Settings. Once validated, you're ready to practice.
bullets: Switch AI mode to OpenAI only or Local preferred.
Run a quick practice item to confirm.
You can remove the key at any time.
